At 17:16 18/04/2007, you wrote:


>On Apr 18, 2007, at 9:02 AM, shanemcdonaldryan wrote:
>
>>I think this approximated sigmoid will give at
>>least a 50% real gain in performance for the problems I am working on
>
>That's great Shane.  I love optimizing code.

You'll also want to read back about for the last time we talked 
through activation function efficiency.

Look for a thread entitled (guess what) "Computation Time" starting 
somewhere around June 2004.  It was a very long running thread.  Also 
Colin wrote his successful optimisation of SharpNeat up here: 
http://sharpneat.sourceforge.net/network_optimization.html

ISRT He got one big speed up from improving memory access patterns, 
and another from choice of activation function.

         Ian
